alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 10:31AM CDT until April 02 at 11:49AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam affecting Clarke, Wilcox and Monroe Counties. For the Alabama River...including Millers Ferry Dam, Claiborne Dam... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 42.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Wednesday was 42.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 46.0 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 42.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
